moves.1. c4: Wildrook28 is a good friend of mine and in the unranked games we have played with each other this opening seems to be the most successful for me against him.
moves.1... e5 2. b3 Nf6 3. Bb2: This is the second time I have ever played this opening, the previous against wildrook28 himself.
moves.3... Nc6 4. Nf3 e4 5. Nd4 Bc5 6. e3 O-O: Was hoping for the en poissant as I have been punished quite a few times in previous games against wildrook28 by his pushed pawns.
moves.8. Qxf3 Nb4 9. Nc3 Qe7 10. Qg3 d6 11. Bd: The major blunder that put me on the back foot and lost both bishops with no gain!
moves.11... Nxd3+ 12. Kf1 Nxb2 13. Ke2 Bg4+ 14: Was in real need of some breathing space!
moves.15... Ne4: This move allowed me to have that taking out an attacker in the lsb
moves.21... Kh8 22. Nxf5 g6 23. Ne7 Rae8 24. N: Threatening mate and also protecting the knight.
Making the sac to get rid of his knight and disrupting his pawn push.
I know I needed to take his pawns on the left side of the board otherwise I would have regretted it.
moves.38... Kh6 39. a4 Re3e2+ 40. Kg1 Re5e4 41: Under a mate threat with both rooks on my second rank.
moves.43. Qf8+ Kg5 44. Rf3 Rexg2+ 45. Kf1 Kg4: The move that lost the game for him.
